title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre on February 27, 2026, showcasing Americana music.
The band played a mix of Jason Isbell's solo songs, 400 Unit tracks, and Drive-By Truckers covers.
Highlights included songs like 'It Gets Easier,' 'Cover Me Up,' and a cover of The Rolling Stones' 'Can't You Hear Me Knocking.'

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers in free agency as prices exceed their budget.
Raiders unlikely to trade Maxx Crosby before the NFL Draft, demanding at least two first-round picks.
Patriots may target Missouri's Zion Young in the draft; he logged 6.5 sacks last season.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance plans to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
The merger could integrate CBS and TNT/TBS, impacting sports coverage for MLB, NHL, and NCAA basketball.
Netflix, after losing the bid, might seek CBS's NFL rights in future broadcast agreements.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots show interest in A.J. Brown, but find the Eagles' trade asking price too high.
Trading Brown before June 1 costs the Eagles $44 million in dead money, reducing cap space by $20 million.
Mike Vrabel suggests the Patriots are open to adding Brown, potentially alongside current receiver Stefon Diggs.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts is replacing E-ZPass transponders with free RFID windshield sticker tags starting Sunday to save costs.
The new E-ZPass stickers, costing 55 cents each, will save the state an estimated $7.4 million annually.
Existing transponders remain functional, and new stickers replace them for free, eliminating the previous $20 fee.

title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jean Brito, of Woburn, accused of evading $1.2 million in income tax, pleads not guilty to 10 charges.
Brito allegedly underreported $20 million in income from his janitorial business, Boston Quality Cleaning Services.
Authorities found $35,000 in cash during a search of Brito's home and Medford business premises.

title: Beware the birds: Bird flu confirmed in Boston
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Bird flu confirmed in Boston's Emerald Necklace park system; public health advisory issued by Boston Public Health Commission.
Risk of human infection from bird flu is currently low; residents advised to avoid contact with wildlife in parks.
CDC reports 71 human cases and 2 deaths from bird flu in the U.S. since February 2024; symptoms include eye irritation and respiratory issues.

title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, likely first pick in 2026 NFL Draft, is excited about the prospect of being mentored by Tom Brady.
Mendoza, a standout from Indiana, spoke briefly with Brady by phone and completed a pre-draft interview with the Raiders.
Mendoza threw 41 touchdowns last season, earning accolades like Heisman Trophy and National Championship Game Offensive MVP.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' starring Jennifer Lopez is available on Hulu.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run' documentary streams on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4, Part 2 is streaming on Netflix.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox outfielders Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a spring training game against the Braves on Friday.
Despite initial concerns, both Anthony and Rafaela remained in the game and recorded hits against ex-teammate Chris Sale.
The collision resulted from miscommunication, with Anthony suffering a bruised arm and Rafaela a minor hamstring issue.
